name: 英文作文（二）
description: This course aims to help students develop skills for academic study. As an introductory course, it focuses on three approaches: expository, persuasive, and research-based composition. Students will learn to identify the purpose of each type of essay and develop appropriate argument strategies. The goal of the course is to help students build their own strategies and integrate different styles into their work.

name: 西洋文學概論（二）
description:
We will examine the legendary stories of heroes and heroines in ancient Greco-Roman literature and trace their origins and development as background of western literature. Selected stories from the biblical texts will also be introduced and discussed in class.
Grading policy
class participation and quizzes (30%) 
weekly written reports (40%)
group oral reports (mid-term 30%)
No final exam

name: 法文（二）
description:
經過一學期的學習，學生已能分辨和適應法語和英語的差異，例如法語的動詞對應不同主詞有不同的動詞變化；名詞、形容詞有陰陽性、單複數的規則與不規則變化等等。這些法語的基本概念仍是第二學期課程的重點。此外，發音訓練仍會持續進行，因為正確的發音是口語溝通的重要條件之一。掌握發音原則臻至熟練，可以減少自習時的障礙，也能增進聽力，讓學習更有成就感。

第二學期，隨著主要教本編排的主題，學生將學習到更多的口語情境與表達技巧。此外也將加入其它補充教材，讓學生有更多演練的機會。另外也將針對學生學習狀況適時加入不同的素材：影片欣賞、法國文化介紹，讓學生能更容易理解法語在生活中應用的狀況。

name: 德文（二）
description:
1. 聽德語CD及學德語歌曲, 讓同學們摹擬及熟悉德語語調, 並訓練同學的德語聽力。
2. 同學們在課堂上輪流朗誦德文並適時給與發音指導, 以訓練同學的德語發音。
3. 分組做日常生活中各種情境的簡單德語對話, 訓練同學造句及口語表達能力。
4. 培養同學的德文閱讀能力。
5. 觀看介紹德語國家生活與文化的影片。
6. 介紹德語國家的風俗民情及重要節慶。

name: 日文（二）
description:
本課程在上學期的發音、名詞句的習得基礎上，繼續教授動詞、形容詞的句型與語法，並練習簡單的會話。
此外，透過歌謠教唱，觀看影片，適度加入日本文化的介紹，期能引發同學學習日文的興趣, 擴展國際視野。
Based on the pronunciation and noun sentence acquisition in the previous semester, we will continue to teach the sentence patterns and grammar of verbs and adjectives. 
And learn conversation in daily life. 
In addition, through singing songs, watching videos, and introducing Japanese culture appropriately, we hope to arouse students' interest in learning Japanese and expand their international horizons.

name: 西班牙文（二）
description:
課程大綱
1、介紹家庭稱謂
2、所有格的用法
3、交通名稱
4、一般動詞之變化及用法
5、時間之表達
課程目標
1、使同學更進一步了解西班牙文的句法及生活用語
2、介紹西班牙語系國家的文化及生活習慣
3、增加學生的對話能力
授課方式
1、老師講解用法並舉例說明
2、學生分組討論並作對話練習
3、透過影片增加學生對西班牙文的興趣及進一步認識西語系國家的風俗民情與文化

name: 英語聽講（二）
description: This course aims to enhance students' English listening and speaking skills through engaging activities and real-world content. Additionally, stressed words and reduction rules will be taught. Students will also become familiar with different accents. The course covers topics such as respect for various culture, health issues, outdoor activities, social media, social activities, outdoor activities etc.

name: 英語聽講（二）
description:
This language course is designed to help students improve their English communication skills with an emphasis on speaking and listening. Students will work with authentic materials and learn to think and articulate their ideas in English through regular practice and in-class activities. The first year focuses on developing presentation skills, improving pronunciation and intelligibility, and acquiring the fundamental principles of expressing thoughts in English. Students will learn how to structure presentations, organize responses, and convey ideas with clarity and persuasiveness. Most importantly, these skills are transferable and crucial to any college-level course and professional field. By the end of the course, students will be able to express themselves in English more fluently and become more confident in sharing ideas and building connections with others in real-life situations and for various academic purposes.

開學第一週請務必準時出席，以確認修課人數及宣佈重要修課事宜。
Please make sure to arrive on time during the first week of the semester for enrollment confirmation and course announcements.

name: 英語聽講（二）
description: This course aims to train students’ pronunciation through systematic practice, develop their listening comprehension through a variety of listening skills training, and improve their speaking ability through extensive speaking practice.

name: 語言學概論（二）
description: This course provides an introduction to linguistics, with a focus on its applied aspects. Key topics include the use of language in society (sociolinguistics), language change over time (historical and comparative linguistics), language acquisition, and the relationship between language and the human brain (neurolinguistics).

name: 德文（四）
description:
1. 聽德語CD及學德語歌曲, 讓同學們摹擬及熟悉德語語調, 並訓練同學的德語聽力。
2. 同學們在課堂上輪流朗誦德文並適時給與發音指導, 以訓練同學的德語發音。
3. 分組做日常生活中各種情境的簡單德語對話, 訓練同學造句及口語表達能力。
4. 培養同學的德文閱讀能力。
5. 觀看介紹德語國家生活與文化的影片。
6. 介紹德語國家的風俗民情及重要節慶。

name: 西班牙文(四)
description:
課程大綱
1、介紹完成式動詞變化及用法
2、介紹過去式動詞變化及用法
3、介紹命令句動詞變化及用法
4、短篇閱讀
課程目標
1、使學生了解完成式、過去式及命令句用法並應用在日常生活對話
2、藉由影片增加學生的興趣
3、增加學生的寫作與閱讀能力
授課方式
1、 老師講解並舉例說明
2、 學生分組討論並做對話練習及寫作練習

name: 法文(四)
description:
進入第四學期的法語學習，學生的文法、聽力與口語能力已有既定的基礎。本學期的學習將以擴充上述基本能力為主要目標，並增進學生的閱讀與寫作能力。

在聽力與口語方面，除了以Le Nouveau Taxi A1為主要教材，繼續基本會話練習，同時將加入其它情境式的會話練習，讓學生更能適應自然的對話與口語表達。

在閱讀部分則將以法國青少年讀物和介紹法國生活 (食、衣、住、行、文化活動)的文章為參考，讓學生辨別口語和書寫的語法差異。在閱讀的過程中，除了複習已學過的文法觀念，也能學習進階的文法，並逐步運用在寫作上。

name: 日文 (四)
description:
1. 接續日文(三)之課程,深入分析日文文法,加強生活日語之會話訓練, 並補充課外閱讀與加強聽力練習, 養成聽說讀寫之日文能力, 並期能達到日語能力檢定五級之目標。
Continuing the course of Japanese 3, conduct an in-depth analysis of Japanese grammar and strengthen conversational training in daily Japanese. And supplement extracurricular reading and strengthen listening exercises, develop Japanese skills in listening, speaking, reading and writing.  And hope can reach the target of Japanese language proficiency test N4～N5.
2. 藉由日文影片與歌曲等, 深入了解日本人之個性與其文化特質,提升學習日語之興趣 , 期能主動學習、拓展國際視野。
Through Japanese videos and songs, etc., we can gain a deeper understanding of Japanese personality and cultural characteristics, enhance our interest in learning Japanese, and hope to actively learn and expand our international horizons.

name: 英語教學理論與實務
description: This course aims to prepare those who are interested in teaching English as a future career. Fundamental understandings of English teaching principles and approaches, including the Grammar Translation Method, Communicative Language Teaching, and Task-based Language Teaching will be introduced. Equipped with such knowledge, you will be guided to discuss and conduct teaching demos in class. We will also learn how to design lessons. By the end of the semester, you should be familiar with techniques and principles of English language teaching and be able to design and teach lessons targeting at elementary/junior high school students effectively.

name: 文學作品讀法
description: This course introduces students to methods and strategies for actively reading literary texts across the three primary genres: fiction, poetry, and drama. Through close reading of selected works, students learn to attend to the textures of language, form, and structure and explore how meaning emerges through these elements in dialogue with the reader. Emphasizing reading as an active, dialogic, and imaginative practice, the course invites students to consider how literature expands the creative possibilities of language and deepens our understanding of life and human experience.

name: 英國文學：十八世紀
description: This course is designed to instruct students to a better understanding of 18th-century literature in English along with its social contexts. As listed in the schedule below, works of four authors will be the focus of this course. In addition to two exams, students are expected to participate actively in class. Group discussions will be held throughout the semester to foster interpretation and critical thinking.

name: 英國文學：維多利亞
description: This course is a general survey of British Victorian literature. Although the era was distinguished by novels, we will focus on poetry, prose, and drama instead. While reading texts of different genres, we will pay special attention to some important Victorian issues, such as gender, industrialism, science, imperialism and social critique. It is expected that students will be equipped with a basic understanding of Victorian literature and culture. The engagement in reading and critical analysis of literary texts and the exploration of Victorian issues will also sharpen students' overall keenness in reading comprehension, logical reasoning and insights into the issues in the past and the present, between the West and the East.

name: 閱讀愛爾蘭
description: The course aims to instruct students in Irish literature after the late 19th century with a cultural approach. Relevant issues such as identity, cultural revival, cultural translation, nationalism, gender, and migration will be incorporated into class discussion whenever appropriate. It is expected that, through this course, students will have a clear picture of the development and transformation of Irish culture and literature, and will, at a deeper and more subtle level, reflect on their own. The works of Yeats, James Joyce, Brian Friel, Seamus Heaney, Neil Jordan, Jan Carson and Sally Rooney  are the focus of study in this semester. This is a highly interactive course; apart from lectures, students’ participation is strongly required.

name: 進階英語聽講
description: This course is included in the "Global Leadership and Sustainable Development" Program (全球領導及永續發展跨領域全英語學分學程), organized by the College of Law (法學院). It aims to enhance students' English listening and speaking abilities from the intermediate to upper intermediate/advanced level(s) through a variety of aural-oral trainings. As well as strengthening students' presentation skills, the course will be consistently set in the context of symposium or forum to discuss issues related to our daily life both domestically and abroad. Thus, it is expected that students can stay alert to news events and get familiar with relevant news lexicon, and that they can be actively engaged in class discussion. With equal focus on American and British English, the course targets at long lectures to orient students with more authentic and professional English settings and to comprehend topic issues for critical discussion.

name: 語言習得
description: This class aims to help you understand how children acquire language from birth to preschool age and the major issues discussed in the field. First, we'll explore theoretical approaches, such as nature vs. nurture, to better understand the current state of language acquisition research. We'll also learn about experimental methods used to study language acquisition, including corpus studies, the truth value judgment task, and the head-turn preference procedure.

name: 文學與人工智慧：人類、機器與想像
科幻小說(一) : 反烏托邦、性別與電影
專題:研究實作與學術寫作
description:
This course offers hands-on experience that can facilitate your personal growth and career exploration. Whether you’re new to research, considering graduate study, or planning to pursue a professional career, you’ll find this course practical and full of opportunities to develop valuable skills.

Who is this course for?
▪	Thinking about graduate school? Gain first-hand experience with academic research and develop a clearer understanding of what it means to work as a researcher.
▪	Planning to apply to graduate programs? Learn essential research and academic writing skills, and produce work that may support future applications.
▪	Preparing for professional careers after graduation? Strengthen problem-solving, critical thinking, and effective communication skills through research-based tasks.

By the end of this course, you will understand core research and academic writing practices and develop practical skills applicable to academic study, professional contexts, and independent projects.

* Class size: Enrollment is limited to 10 students to ensure interactive discussions and personalized guidance.

name: 批判性閱讀與寫作：當代社會文化議題
description: This course introduces critical reading and writing as essential skills for engaging with contemporary sociocultural issues. Drawing on methods from literary and cultural studies, students analyze how cultural meanings are produced, circulated, and contested in social contexts. Through essays, fiction, academic articles, and films, the course examines sociocultural issues related to language and representation, identity and subjectivity, and media and popular culture, with attention to their cultural politics. Emphasizing humanities-based inquiry, the course helps students develop their ability to evaluate arguments, analyze competing perspectives, and produce evidence-based writing that expresses informed positions on current sociocultural topics.

name: 羅賓漢故事與亞瑟王傳奇
description:
We will examine a wide range of literary texts concerning Robin Hood and King Arthur arranged in chronological order from the Anglo-Saxon period up to the Tudor dynasty. Selected works are to show the rich diversity of Celtic myths and Celtic legends across the European continent and Britain. Specific passages will be introduced and discussed in class. A special attention will focus on modern critical approaches to folklore as literature. We will also have one to two guest speakers to lecture on literary theories and practices.
Grading policy:
class participation (25%) 
weekly written reports (50%)
group oral reports (mid-term 25%)
No final exam

name: 文學教學實務
description: This course explores effective approaches to teaching literature across genres, with a focus on drama, fiction, and poetry. Students learn main approaches of reading literature while developing practical strategies for lesson design. Emphasis is on creating learning activities that foster interpretation, critical thinking, and engagement with texts. Participants design lesson plans, practice teaching activities, and reflect on their teaching performances. By the end of the course, students will be familiar with key genre elements and techniques for teaching literature effectively at the high school level.
